sentences.english: Yet all this betrays a dangerous complacency.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這種自滿是非常危險的。

sentences.english: But my fear for this new generation is that they have become complacent, or worse.
sentences.chinese: 但我對這代人的擔心是他們已經變得自滿，甚至更糟。

sentences.english: He became self-satisfied because of a few achievements.
sentences.chinese: 他有了一些成績就自滿起來。
但是自滿卻是一個危險的敵人。

sentences.english: There was a note of self-satisfaction in his speech.
sentences.chinese: 他的發言帶了一點驕傲自滿的口氣。

sentences.english: During this stage, a kind of conceit appeared within the Party.
sentences.chinese: 在這時期，黨內出現了驕傲自滿的情緒。

sentences.english: We must not become complacent the moment we have some success.
sentences.chinese: 我們決不能一見成績就自滿起來。

sentences.english: I argue that it is complacence.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲自滿，就是心之凶德。

sentences.english: But this doesn't mean we can be complacent.
sentences.chinese: 但是這並不意味着我們可以自滿。

sentences.english: Such success may have bred complacency.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的成績可能已經醞釀了驕傲自滿的情緒。

sentences.english: She charged her failure to self-conceit .
sentences.chinese: 她把她的失敗歸因於自滿。

sentences.english: But this success may have led to complacency.
sentences.chinese: 但是這成功可能帶來驕傲自滿。

sentences.english: As these guys took action in the beginning of the relationship, they became complacent.
sentences.chinese: 隨着他們在關係的開端的採取的行動，他們變得自滿。
但是，陳馮富珍告戒人們不要自滿。

sentences.english: He accused the government of slackness and complacency.
sentences.chinese: 他譴責政府的懈怠和自滿。

sentences.english: But love to God and man was eclipsed by pride and self-sufficiency.
sentences.chinese: 但愛上帝和愛人的心被驕傲自滿的心所淹沒了。

definition: to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to turn a blind eye to
to seize every opportunity/to be full of tricks
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to think sth through/to consider carefully
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
